RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the jury: jury in Maria De Jesus Garcia's trial

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the federal district court is located
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Moore, Texas: location where the incident occurred, approximately 115 miles from the United States-Mexican border, and where border patrol agents had recently apprehended a number of illegal alien smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where the incident took place, with northbound lanes, leading directly to the United States-Mexican border and passing through Laredo, Texas, known as a common smuggling route with a history of alien smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexican border: geographical reference point, approximately 115 miles from Moore, Texas, relevant for roving border patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographical reference point relevant for roving border patrol stops and the Brignoni-Ponce test
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: location through which Interstate 35 passes, one of the towns before reaching Moore
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce standard: a standard for reasonably warranting suspicion in border patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.5th Circuit Court of Appeals: US Court of Appeals circuit that issued a ruling on probable cause for searching vehicles and has upheld the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's vehicle: vehicle searched for undocumented aliens and subject of a court case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.camper compartment of Maria De Jesus Gar: part of the vehicle where additional undocumented aliens were suspected to be hiding
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.jury in Maria De Jesus Garcia's trial: jury that received a modified Allen charge during deliberations
